verses.kjv: In the third month, when the children of Israel were gone forth out of the land of Egypt, the same day came they into the wilderness of Sinai.
verses.ct: In the 3rd month after the Israelites had left Egypt, on that very day, they arrived in the wilderness of Sinai.

verses.kjv: For they were departed from Rephidim, and were come to the desert of Sinai, and had pitched in the wilderness; and there Israel camped before the mount.
verses.ct: They had moved on from Rephidim and entered the Sinai desert, where they set up camp in the wilderness. Israel camped there in front of the mountain.

verses.kjv: And Moses went up unto God, and the LORD called unto him out of the mountain, saying, Thus shalt thou say to the house of Jacob, and tell the children of Israel;
verses.ct: Moses climbed up to God, and the LORD called out to him from the mountain, saying, "This is what you are to say to the house of Jacob and tell the Israelites:

verses.kjv: Ye have seen what I did unto the Egyptians, and how I bare you on eagles’ wings, and brought you unto myself.
verses.ct: 'You saw what I did to the Egyptians, and how I carried you on eagles' wings and brought you to myself.

verses.kjv: Now therefore, if ye will obey my voice indeed, and keep my covenant, then ye shall be a peculiar treasure unto me above all people: for all the earth is mine:
verses.ct: So now, if you truly listen to me and keep my covenant, then you will be my treasured possession out of all the nations. The whole earth belongs to me,

verses.kjv: And ye shall be unto me a kingdom of priests, and an holy nation. These are the words which thou shalt speak unto the children of Israel.
verses.ct: but you will be a kingdom of priests for me, a holy nation.' These are the words you must speak to the Israelites."

verses.kjv: And Moses came and called for the elders of the people, and laid before their faces all these words which the LORD commanded him.
verses.ct: Moses went back and summoned the elders of the people. He presented to them everything the LORD had commanded him to say.

verses.kjv: And all the people answered together, and said, All that the LORD hath spoken we will do. And Moses returned the words of the people unto the LORD.
verses.ct: All the people responded in unison, "We will do everything the LORD has said." Then Moses brought the people's answer back to the LORD.

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto Moses, Lo, I come unto thee in a thick cloud, that the people may hear when I speak with thee, and believe thee for ever. And Moses told the words of the people unto the LORD.
verses.ct: The LORD said to Moses, "Pay attention — I am going to come to you in a dense cloud so that the people will hear me speaking with you and will trust you from now on." Moses then reported what the people had said to the LORD.

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto Moses, Go unto the people, and sanctify them to day and to morrow, and let them wash their clothes,
verses.ct: The LORD told Moses, "Go to the people and set them apart as holy today and tomorrow. Have them wash their clothes

verses.kjv: And be ready against the third day: for the third day the LORD will come down in the sight of all the people upon mount Sinai.
verses.ct: and be prepared by the 3rd day, because on the 3rd day the LORD will come down on Mount Sinai where all the people can see.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt set bounds unto the people round about, saying, Take heed to yourselves, that ye go not up into the mount, or touch the border of it: whosoever toucheth the mount shall be surely put to death:
verses.ct: You must set boundaries around the mountain for the people and tell them, 'Be careful that you don't go up the mountain or even touch its edge. Anyone who touches the mountain will certainly be put to death.

verses.kjv: There shall not an hand touch it, but he shall surely be stoned, or shot through; whether it be beast or man, it shall not live: when the trumpet soundeth long, they shall come up to the mount.
verses.ct: No one's hand may touch that person — they must be stoned or shot with arrows. Whether animal or human, they must not survive. Only when the trumpet gives a long blast may they approach the mountain.'"

verses.kjv: And Moses went down from the mount unto the people, and sanctified the people; and they washed their clothes.
verses.ct: Moses went down from the mountain to the people and set them apart as holy, and they washed their clothes.

verses.kjv: And he said unto the people, Be ready against the third day: come not at your wives.
verses.ct: He told the people, "Be prepared by the 3rd day. Do not have relations with your wives."

verses.kjv: And it came to pass on the third day in the morning, that there were thunders and lightnings, and a thick cloud upon the mount, and the voice of the trumpet exceeding loud; so that all the people that was in the camp trembled.
verses.ct: On the morning of the 3rd day, there was thunder and lightning, with a thick cloud covering the mountain and an extremely loud trumpet blast. Everyone in the camp shook with fear.

verses.kjv: And Moses brought forth the people out of the camp to meet with God; and they stood at the nether part of the mount.
verses.ct: Moses led the people out of the camp to meet with God, and they took their place at the base of the mountain.

verses.kjv: And mount Sinai was altogether on a smoke, because the LORD descended upon it in fire: and the smoke thereof ascended as the smoke of a furnace, and the whole mount quaked greatly.
verses.ct: Mount Sinai was completely covered in smoke because the LORD had descended on it in fire. The smoke rose up like smoke from a furnace, and the entire mountain shook violently.

verses.kjv: And when the voice of the trumpet sounded long, and waxed louder and louder, Moses spake, and God answered him by a voice.
verses.ct: As the sound of the trumpet grew longer and louder and louder, Moses spoke, and God answered him with a voice.

verses.kjv: And the LORD came down upon mount Sinai, on the top of the mount: and the LORD called Moses up to the top of the mount; and Moses went up.
verses.ct: The LORD came down onto the peak of Mount Sinai, and he called Moses to come up to the top. So Moses climbed up.

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto Moses, Go down, charge the people, lest they break through unto the LORD to gaze, and many of them perish.
verses.ct: The LORD said to Moses, "Go back down and warn the people not to push past the boundaries to stare at the LORD, or many of them will die.

verses.kjv: And let the priests also, which come near to the LORD, sanctify themselves, lest the LORD break forth upon them.
verses.ct: Even the priests who approach the LORD must set themselves apart as holy, or the LORD will strike out against them."

verses.kjv: And Moses said unto the LORD, The people cannot come up to mount Sinai: for thou chargedst us, saying, Set bounds about the mount, and sanctify it.
verses.ct: Moses replied to the LORD, "The people are not able to come up Mount Sinai, because you yourself warned us, saying, 'Set boundaries around the mountain and set it apart as holy.'"

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto him, Away, get thee down, and thou shalt come up, thou, and Aaron with thee: but let not the priests and the people break through to come up unto the LORD, lest he break forth upon them.
verses.ct: The LORD told him, "Go on, head back down, and then come up again with Aaron. But the priests and the people must not push past the boundaries to come up to the LORD, or he will strike out against them."

verses.kjv: So Moses went down unto the people, and spake unto them.
verses.ct: So Moses went back down to the people and told them.
